=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2020/10/29
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español', 'Français'], 'Directors': ['Julie Taymor'], 'Producers': ['Julie Taymor', 'Lynn Hendee'], 'Starring': ['Julianne Moore', 'Alicia Vikander', 'Timothy Hutton'], 'Studio': ['Roadside Attractions']}
Review Text: True to life as many of us in the movement did not support abortion as one of the principles. Women's health and birth control yes, but not abortion. I thank the writers for capturing this important point.  Abortion at the time was seen as an absolute LAST resort. Things need to be reevaluated now and provide far improved supports for women who choose life. Pro-life IS Pro Women.
Review Title: I enjoyed this movie because it really caught the essence of the movement
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Maureen Castle Tusty', 'James Tusty'], 'Producers': ['Thomas Skinner', 'Robert Chatfield', 'Bob Chitester', 'Tom Jennings'], 'Starring': ['Johan Norberg', 'Dr. Tom G. Palmer', 'Sofia Olsson Olsen'], 'Studio': ['Free To Choose Media']}
What this movie tells us is the American political system is bogged down in politics and not working to improve our country. They, for the most part, those career politicians have lost sight of real life in America. They may never have known reality. They are not solving problems or issues. It's too slow and cumbersome. We need more control to the States and to non Government solutions. Let's start with school vouchers.
Hits on all the important points of economics
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Luke McManus'], 'Producers': ['Pierce Boyce', 'Eileen Seoighe'], 'Studio': ['Janson Media']}
Love it and learned a great deal.
Very interesting and unique
Call of the Forest: The Forgotten Wisdom of Trees
Special Interest, Documentary, Feel-good, Sweet
['Take a walk in the woods with acclaimed Irish-Canadian scientist and author, Diana Beresford-Kroeger, as she reveals our profound human connection to the ancient & sacred northern forests and the essential role that they play in sustaining the health of our planet. Directed by Peabody-award winner Jeff McKay, and produced by Merit Motion Pictures and Edgeland Films.']
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jeff McKay'], 'Producers': ['Merit Jensen Carr'], 'Starring': ['Diana Beresford-Kroeger']}
We have harmed this planet in so many ways. To understand the connection between the Forest and all living things is so important for all of us. To think about how areas have been completely ravaged of their forests is horrible. I will plant a tree or two every year. We must restore our planet. It does not matter what you believe as far as climate change. We cannot live with a destroyed planet and it starts with our forests.
Fantastic and sad at the same time. Please watch and learn. Share it too.

**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Rating Tendencies:** The user maintains a strong positive rating average of approximately 4.4, recently awarding a perfect score of 5.0, showcasing their appreciation for impactful narratives and performances.

- **Content Preferences:** The user has demonstrated a clear preference for narrative-driven films with themes of redemption, emotional depth, and a strong interest in socio-political commentary and environmental issues. Their latest interaction reveals a heightened enthusiasm for films that explore complex social topics, particularly regarding women's health, with a focus on promoting positive change and education.

- **Quality Appreciation:** The user continues to prioritize powerful acting performances and high production quality, favoring projects that feature respected actors and thoughtful direction.

- **Language and Subtitles:** The user consistently prefers English for both audio and subtitles, ensuring a clear viewing experience.

- **Notable Collaborations:** Loyalty to acclaimed directors and producers remains evident, with ongoing interest in their recent works and collaborations, particularly those tackling significant societal themes.

- **Overall Sentiment:** The user exhibits a discerning taste that combines an appreciation for emotionally resonant storytelling with a deep engagement in narratives addressing political and environmental subjects. Their recent interaction reflects a commitment to exploring films that capture nuanced perspectives on women's issues while conveying hope and encouraging proactive responses to societal challenges.
